intro: Sanguisorba eriocarpum, commonly known as the downy bloodwort, is a flowering plant native to temperate regions of Asia. It belongs to the rose family (Rosaceae) and is characterized by its upright growth habit and clustered inflorescences. The plant features narrow, lance-shaped leaves with a soft, downy texture on the underside. Its flowers are pink to red in color, appearing in dense clusters during the summer months. Sanguisorba eriocarpum is often found in moist meadows and woodland edges, where it thrives in partial shade to full sun.
